content.p: Our CASE studentships will give you the opportunity to work in partnership with industry, undertaking an industry placement and benefiting from an industrial supervisor as part of your supervisory team. You will benefit from joining the BBSRC DTP community of over 220 postgraduate researchers, partaking in a broad range of training opportunities including the annual DTP conference. Recruitment is now open until 12 noon (UK time) on 31 January 2025 Insula and cingulate contributions to the control of tic-like movements and other behaviours relevant to Touretteâ€™s syndrome Novel self-oxygenating and cell-instructive materials for chronic wound healing Deciphering Oral Movements in Health & Disease using MRI imaging and computer vision Maedi-Visna Virus Variation in UK sheep flocks: implications for virus control Developmental consequences of heat stress on pre-elongating and gastrulating pig embryos Using virus-like particles to understand the key success criteria in dsRNA delivery for crop protection The University of Nottingham University Park Nottingham, NG7 2RD Tel: +44 (0) 115 8466946 Email: bbdtp@nottingham.ac.uk
